page.title: warrenshea.com
page.primary:
Welcome !

This site showcases my online portfolio, provides a proficiency summary of my skills, and highlights milestones in my previous employment experience. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me.

What I offer

I'm an all-around web expert that believes in high quality of work and doing what is best rather than what is fastest. I bring energy and a positive attitude to this career that I love. I'm easy to work with and I listen to others but voice my own concerns and opinions if needed. I am fundamentally an independent developer who enjoys challenging puzzles and organized code.

What to expect from me

Reliability - I meet my deadlines and the people that I work with have faith in my work. I have a personally high standard of quality and always develop to the best of my current abilities.

Passion - I love web development and design. I develop personal projects after work and on weekends. My learning doesn't stop when the work day is over and I'm constantly trying to find new ways to improve my abilities in my free time.

Solutions and options - "I don't believe in the no-win scenario". I enjoy problem solving and rarely give up if I believe there's a possible solution to a problem. I can't turn off my brain when I'm faced with something I can't figure out.

Evolution - Whether it's learning new development languages, staying on top of current technological trends, or improving my soft skills, I'm always trying to improve and adapt. In the professional world, survival means keeping a sharp mind and understanding what skills will be useful in the future.

What I'm looking for

At the moment, I am not really looking for a new role as I've recently started a new role as Development Lead as of June 2013. I'd like to see where this role takes me before pursuing other opportunities. Unless the opportunity is too good to pass up ;)

page.secondary:
Web qualifications

Development techniques
Responsive Design, OOP, AJAX, JSON, XML, XSLT, DOM, DHTML, CSS Sprites, CSS Reset, CSS Grid Layout, and Dynamic CSS

Web accessibility
Practical knowledge and experience with the WCAG 2.0 Level AA standards including fundamental Color Contrast principles

Best practices
HTML semantics. Decreasing latency. Efficient and proper use of web image types.

Multiple browser support
Support of Chrome, Firefox, Internet Explorer (including IE6 and IE7), Safari, Camino, Opera, and Chrome Frame

SEO
Familiar with web analytics (Adobe Site Catalyst, Omniture, Google Analytics, and WebTrends), Google Web Optimizer (A/B & Multivariate Testing)

APIs
Facebook, Twitter, Google Chart, YouTube, Google Maps, and Feedburner
